name: Intermediate Flutter Quiz
description: A quiz set for those who have some knowledge and experience.
author: WSBT

questions.title: What are some types of widgets in Flutter?
candidates: DynamicWidget

questions.title: What are some proxy widgets in Flutter?
candidates: RenderObjectWidget
LeafRenderObject

questions.title: What is a `BuildContext` in Flutter?
answers: It's an interface for developers to avoid directly using Elements
candidates: It's method called every animation frame to build and render widgets
It's the parent class of all stateless and stateful widgets
It's a run-time context that contains information about the current device such as screen brightness

questions.title: What's `Navigator` in Flutter used for?
candidates: Finding widgets that are higher in the widget tree
Finding the corresponding element of a given widget
Building the common navigation menu UI

questions.title: What are some life-cycle events in a StatefulWidget?
candidates: didChangeState()
DidUpdateParentData()

questions.title: How do you transition to a new screen using MaterialApp routes?
candidates: By using the `MaterialApp.open` method
By calling the `Route.to` method
By setting the `route` property of the `MaterialApp` widget

questions.title: What is `WillPopScope` used for in Flutter?
answers: It allows developers to intercept a popping event
candidates: It pops the current screen to go back to the previous screen
It allows popping multiple screens at once
It's for pushing a new replacement screen and popping the previous one

questions.title: How can you get the result of a dialog in Flutter?
candidates: By listening to the `showDialog` result stream
By setting a callback to the `showDialog` function
By using a `DialogResult` widget

questions.title: What is `CustomPaint` used for in Flutter?
answers: To provide a canvas on which to draw during the paint phase
candidates: To customize the default style of Flutter widgets
To paint an image from an asset with customized filters
To help render texts with custom fonts

questions.title: What does a `sliver` in Flutter refer to?
answers: A portion of scrollable area on the screen
candidates: An error in the Flutter framework
A special kind of animation with glowing effects
A method of theming
